AspNetCoreHostingModel.description: Indicates whether to run an ASP.NET Core application using IIS in-process or out-of-process.

values.InProcess: Run the app using IIS in-process
values.OutOfProcess: Run the app using IIS out-of-process

AspNetCoreModuleName.description: Indicates which AspNetCoreModule version to use. Versions include V1 and V2.

UserSecretsId.description: The ID that will be used to locate the file storing secret configuration values for this project at development time. Although by default this is a GUID value, arbitrary strings may be used.

BlazorEnableTimeZoneSupport.description: Indicates whether Blazor WebAssembly should include a data file to make timezone information correct. Setting this to `false` will reduce your app size.

RunAOTCompilation.description: Indicates whether to run the Ahead-of-Time (AOT) compiler on the Blazor WebAssembly app. Setting this to `true` will increase runtime performance of your WebAssembly application but will also increase its deployable size.

WasmStripILAfterAOT.description: Whether to remove .NET IL for compiled methods after WebAssembly AOT compilation

IsTransformWebConfigDisabled.description: Whether to prevent the SDK from transforming the `web.config` file
